ok, let us put this this way.
your synaptic pulls a list of packages from a file, that is located at /etc/apt/sources.list
also, synaptic has a function to add repositories, so, you could add the repository manually into the file, or you could do it through synaptic.
what are you trying to tell me to do ? chek the file?

to learn how to do it through synaptic, visit http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/AddingRepositoriesHowto . to add it manually, you would open the file with sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list, and replace what is in it with http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/969 , then save, close, and then reload your package list.
I am giving you knowledge, not instructions.
